sent: The term 'augmented reality' was first coined in 1992 by thomas caudell and david mizell.
quiz:

A) 1985
B) 1992
C) 2005
D) 2010

Correct answer: B) 1992

sent: Two engineers worka on a simple see-through headset that aided airplane engineers in complex wiring schematics.
quiz:

C) To listen to music while working

The correct answer is B) To aid airplane engineers in complex wiring schematics.

sent: According to their documentation, the goal of augmented reality commonly abbreviated as AR was to enable cost reductions and efficiency improvements in many of the human involved operations in aircraft manufacturing.
quiz:
What was the goal of augmented reality in aircraft manufacturing?

a) To increase production time 
b) To enable cost reductions and efficiency improvements 
c) To replace human labor 
d) To make the manufacturing process more complicated 

Correct answer: b) To enable cost reductions and efficiency improvements.

sent: We've been dreaming about the potential of AR for a long time and the history of the medium stretches back before we even had a term for it.

A) A few years ago
B) In the early 2000s
C) Before the term AR was even coined

The correct answer is C) Before the term AR was even coined.

sent: In fact AR shares a history with its technological cousin virtual reality both virtual reality or VR and AR share a common ancestor the sword of damocles built in 1968.
quiz:
What do virtual reality and augmented reality have in common?

A) They both share a common ancestor called The Sword of Damocles
B) They were both invented in the early 2000s
C) They were both created by Google

Answer: A) They both share a common ancestor called The Sword of Damocles.

sent: The sword of damocles was created by computer scientist and researcher ivan sutherland his goal was to create the ultimate display a digital interface capable of transforming the physical world.

A) Leonardo da Vinci
B) Ivan Sutherland
C) Albert Einstein
D) Stephen Hawking

Correct answer: B) Ivan Sutherland

sent: There are a few basic rules that augmented reality creators need to remember about the way objects behave in AR.

Correct answer: B) Objects in AR should interact with the physical world in the same way as they do in real life.

sent: The first of these behaviors is place stationary ar objects need to stick to one point in a given environment.

A) Move continuously around the environment
B) Stick to one point in the environment
C) Disappear from the environment
D) Change colors frequently in the environment

Correct Answer: B) Stick to one point in the environment

sent: This could be something concrete such as a wall floor or ceiling or it could be suspended somewhere in midair whatever the case placing means these objects stay where they're positioned even when users are in motion the mug on your coffee table doesn't jump around when you move your head if you look away.

What does placing mean in virtual reality?

A) Objects become invisible 
B) Objects move around with the user

Answer: C) Objects stay where they're positioned

sent: It's right there when you look back again for AR to maintain the illusion of reality digital objects need to behave in the same way real ones do.

B) Digital objects need to behave in the same way real ones do

Correct Answer: B) Digital objects need to behave in the same way real ones do.

Which of the following is NOT important in scaling together in AR?

A) Placing
B) Viewing from afar
C) Scaling
D) None of the above

D) None of the above

sent: Occlusion refers to what happens when an image or object is blocked by another move your hand in front of your face like this you've just occluded the computer screen with your hand.
quiz:
What does occlusion mean?
A) When an object is made brighter by another object
B) When an object is blocked by another object 
C) When an object is moving towards another object

Correct answer: B) When an object is blocked by another object

sent: However imagine if you moved your hand in front of your face and the screen was still visible.
quiz:
What is the author implying by saying "imagine if you moved your hand in front of your face and the screen was still visible"?

A) The screen cannot be seen when the hand is blocking it.
B) The screen remains visible even when the hand is blocking it.
C) The screen disappears when the hand is blocking it.

Correct answer: B) The screen remains visible even when the hand is blocking it.

sent: You'd probably get a little concerned.
quiz:
Here's a multiple-choice quiz question for you based on what I said: 

What might a teacher feel if a student consistently performs poorly?

A) Excited 
B) Indifferent 
C) Concerned 

Correct answer: C) Concerned

sent: AR objects have to play by the rules of occlusion if we want them to seem real.
quiz:
Quiz question: What is the reason for AR objects to play by the rules of occlusion? 

A) To make them more transparent 
B) To make them seem detached from the real world 
C) To make them seem real 

Correct answer: C) To make them seem real.

sent: This means that AR hardware has to not only understand where the object is in the room but also its relative distance from the user compared with any other object physical or digital.
quiz:
Question: What does AR hardware need to understand to place digital objects in a physical space? 

A) The color and texture of the physical objects 
B) The distance between the physical objects 
C) The time of day 

Correct answer: B) The distance between the physical objects

sent: Occlusion means hiding virtual objects behind other virtual objects and ones in the real world say you move behind a wall while using AR.
quiz:
What is the meaning of Occlusion in AR?
A) It means creating virtual objects
B) It means hiding virtual objects behind other virtual objects and ones in the real world
C) It means displaying real objects as virtual objects

Correct answer: B) It means hiding virtual objects behind other virtual objects and ones in the real world.

sent: If you still see the AR objects it will break your sense of immersion that sense of AR objects actually being in the real world in the app seamless.
quiz:
What does seeing the AR objects while using augmented reality break?

A) The sense of immersion 
B) The sense of reality 
C) The sense of fantasy 

Answer: A) The sense of immersion.

sent: Occlusion requires constant recalibration as users can move in any direction at any given moment which is why it's one of the trickiest aspects of building successful AR content.
quiz:
What makes occlusion one of the trickiest aspects of building successful AR content? 
A) It requires minimal recalibration
B) Users can only move in one direction
C) Users can move in any direction at any given moment
D) Occlusion is not important for building successful AR content

Correct Answer: C) Users can move in any direction at any given moment which requires constant recalibration of occlusion for successful AR content.

sent: We'll talk later about the ways that this is currently a technical constraint in mobile AR.
quiz:
Which of the following is currently a technical constraint in mobile AR?

A) Limited processing power in mobile devices.
B) Limited battery life for mobile devices.
C) Limited screen size of mobile devices.
D) Limited wireless connectivity of mobile devices.

Answer: A) Limited processing power in mobile devices.

sent: That developers need to consider in their apps just like a real world object.
quiz:
What do developers need to consider in their apps?

A) Only the appearance of the app
B) The functionality of the app only 
C) Both the appearance and functionality of the app

Correct answer: C) Both the appearance and functionality of the app

sent: Objects in AR need to respond to different patterns of lighting to make sense in our minds.
quiz:
Which of the following is a reason why objects in AR need to respond to different patterns of lighting?

A) To make them appear more colorful
B) To save battery life on mobile devices
C) To make them appear more realistic 

Correct answer: C) To make them appear more realistic.

sent: The colors shading and shadows cast by these objects all need to behave properly both in the initial lighting of a scene and in the case of a lighting change.
quiz:
Which of the following is important for colors, shading, and shadows in a scene?

A. Only in the initial lighting
B. Only in the case of a lighting change
C. Both in the initial lighting and in the case of a lighting change - (Correct Answer)

sent: For example, if you dim the lights during an ar experience then the ar objects should change in color and shading appearance similarly if you move an object around.
quiz:
Question: If you dim the lights during an AR experience, what should happen to the appearance of the AR objects?

A) They should disappear 
B) They should remain the same 
C) They should change in color and shading appearance 

Correct answer: C) They should change in color and shading appearance

sent: The shadows need to move accordingly just like they would in real life.
quiz:
Which of the following statements is true about shadows in a presentation? 

A. Shadows in a presentation do not need to move.
B. Shadows in a presentation should move randomly.
C. Shadows in a presentation need to move accordingly just like they would in real life.

Correct Answer: C. Shadows in a presentation need to move accordingly just like they would in real life.

sent: AR objects need to appear solid.
quiz:
Which of the following is true about AR objects? 

A) They are transparent 
B) They need to appear solid 
C) They should always be animated
D) They can be completely invisible 

Correct answer: B) They need to appear solid

sent: This may sound obvious but it takes conscious effort to achieve as you engage with and ultimately create AR content keep this in mind.
quiz:
What does it take to achieve conscious engagement in creating AR content? 

A) Unconscious effort 
B) No effort 
C) Conscious effort (Correct answer) 
D) Low effort

sent: AR objects should never overlap with real world objects nor should they appear to be floating in thin air, if they're not something like an airplane or balloon.
quiz:
Which of the following is true about AR objects? 

A) They should always overlap with real world objects. 

B) They should never overlap with real world objects. 

C) They should appear to be floating in thin air. 

D) None of the above.

Correct answer: B) They should never overlap with real world objects.

sent: If either of these missteps is in your app, it will break immersion for your users.
quiz:
Which of the following missteps will break immersion for app users?
a) Slow loading times
b) Inconsistent design
c) Both a and b

Correct answer: c) Both a and b.

sent: The final component of realism context awareness is the most difficult to achieve as we discussed in the last video.
quiz:
What is the most challenging component of realism context awareness? 

A) The ability to render graphics in real-time 
B) The accuracy of physical responses to user input 
C) The final component 

Answer: C) The final component

sent: AR hardware has to be aware of essentially every single object in its environment.
quiz:
Which of the following statements about AR hardware is true?

A) AR hardware doesn't need to be aware of every object in its environment
B) AR hardware only needs to be aware of some objects in its environment
C) AR hardware has to be aware of essentially every single object in its environment

The correct answer is C) AR hardware has to be aware of essentially every single object in its environment.

sent: It needs to understand that there is a desk a chair and a table next to a bookcase.
quiz:
Question: What are the objects located near the bookcase? 

A) A lamp and a sofa 
B) A desk, a chair, and a table 
C) A plant and a rug 
D) None of the above 

Correct answer choice: B) A desk, a chair, and a table.

sent: A vase and a television and it needs to know which of these items is taller shorter fatter or wider than the others and how this changes when the subject moves around in space.
quiz:
Which item would appear taller if it was placed behind the other?

A) The Vase
B) The Television
C) They would both appear to be the same height

Answer: A) The Vase

sent: That's a lot to track generating this awareness quickly and without a drop in the digital object's fidelity.
quiz:
Quiz Question: What is the challenge in generating awareness of digital objects quickly?

A. Ensuring high-quality digital objects
B. Minimizing the drop in digital object's fidelity
C. Creating a large number of digital objects
D. Providing access to digital objects

Correct Answer: B. Minimizing the drop in digital object's fidelity

sent: Smoothness or functionality is one of the biggest challenges facing AR creators today companies like google are investing in software tools like AR core to help address some of these issues.
quiz:
What is one of the biggest challenges facing AR creators today?

A) Lack of creativity
B) Limited resources
C) Smoothness or functionality 

Correct answer: C) Smoothness or functionality
